input: question: What was the result for Admiral Byng? [SEP] sentence: A British attempt at relief was foiled at the Battle of Minorca, and the island was captured on 28 June (for which Admiral Byng was court-martialed and executed).

question: Along with the Six Ages, what other scheme did writers in the Middle Ages use to divide history? [SEP] sentence: Medieval writers divided history into periods such as the "Six Ages" or the "Four Empires", and considered their time to be the last before the end of the world.
question: Who oversees and manages the London Fire Brigade? [SEP] sentence: The London Fire Brigade is the statutory fire and rescue service for Greater London.
question: What location has become famous for bird overshooters? [SEP] sentence: Certain areas, because of their location, have become famous as watchpoints for such birds.

question: How many 3 star Michelin restaurants were in France in 2015? [SEP] sentence: In 2015, of the 29 Michelin three-star restaurants in France, nine are located in Paris.

question: What is supposed to be the last resort for police? [SEP] sentence: The use of firearms or deadly force is typically a last resort only to be used when necessary to save human life, although some jurisdictions (such as Brazil) allow its use against fleeing felons and escaped convicts.

question: Why was there a large population of Algonquian people in Bermuda? [SEP] sentence: Most of Bermuda's black population trace some of their ancestry to Native Americans, although awareness of this is largely limited to St David's Islanders and most who have such ancestry are unaware of it.

question: What branch of the Uralic language family does Estonian belong to? [SEP] sentence: Estonian (eesti keel [ˈeːsti ˈkeːl] ( listen)) is the official language of Estonia, spoken natively by about 1.1 million people in Estonia and tens of thousands in various migrant communities.

question: What harms the adherence to the Constitution in Thailand? [SEP] sentence: In Thailand, a kingdom that has had a constitution since the initial attempt to overthrow the absolute monarchy system in 1932, the rule of law has been more of a principle than actual practice.[citation needed]
question: What kinds of agreements do contract law cover? [SEP] sentence: Contract law covers obligations established by agreement (express or implied) between private parties.
question: What does Link say when attacking? [SEP] sentence: There is very little voice acting in the game, as is the case in most Zelda titles to date.

question: Who was allowed to leave the village? [SEP] sentence: It bound the peasant to the land, as only one son (not the eldest) was permitted to leave the village; townsfolk (Polish: "mieszczaństwo") were prohibited from owning land; and positions in the Church hierarchy could be given only to nobles.

question: What formerly effective tool for international disputes is no longer effective among peer powers? [SEP] sentence: As evidence, Baron outlines that since the Cuban missile crisis (1962) during the Cold War, these influential Western nations have resolved all disputes among the great powers peacefully at the United Nations and other forums of international discussion.
question: Half of the top earners were mostly in what field? [SEP] sentence: Some prominent medical schools have since tightened rules on faculty acceptance of such payments by drug companies.
question: How many unique phenomes are usually attributed to Dutch? [SEP] sentence: All three are commonly the only ones considered unique phonemes in Dutch.
